resources.string: With your shoes still off take a step, pay attention to how the weight distributes along your foot. How are your feet positioned while walking?
Feet stikefloor with heel first then roll towards the toes. Your arch lightly collapses inward. This is neutral pronation!
Looks like the whole sole of your foot touches the ground. This means that you are an over pronator and the arch of your foot stretches inward too much.
Outside of your foot has the most impact. This means that you are a under pronator. Your feet don\'t flex enough to provide proper shock absorption.
Where do you want to run?
Take your shoes off and stand on one foot to see how balanced you feel, do you feel:
Do you need a special fit? (for width)
